name.description: Name of the location, facility, or the service provided by the clinic. Typically available at the top of the page or in the contact section. Do NOT use the address as the name which may be street/ state like 'Henry Adams, SF'. Double check that this is not the case

address.description:
The COMPLETE address of the location using inner text of address elements. This value MUST be the combination of the building name or medical center name, street, city, state, and ZIP. EXAMPLE: `John Ivy Medical Center
199 Test Street
Test, CA 94103.` Concatenate multiple elements together as needed and retain formatting if possible. The building name may be placed above the other address elements. You MUST include the building name if it is available and presented this way. Do not forget ANY of the address elements. Filter out extra words at the beginning like 'Address:' or extra words at the end like 'Phone', 'Fax', 'Directions', etc. Do not use value from additional locations.

phone.description: The primary phone number of the primary location. Ensure it is the phone number of the main location. This should be positioned higher than other phone numbers. Only include the number but retain its formatting. Strip all leading or trailing words like 'Phone'. Do not use the phone value from related locations. This phone value will probably be positioned close to other contact fields.

fax.description: The primary FAX number of the location. Only include the number but retain its formatting by stripping all leading or trailing words like 'Fax'. Ensure the fax number you select is LABELED as a FAX number on the page via text or an icon. If there is no number labeled as fax on the page, this value MUST be left as NULL. Never assume unlabeled numbers are the fax number. Do not use value from related locations.

job_id.description: Unique alphanumeric identifier for the job posting.

company_name.description: Name of the company offering the job.

company_description.description: A brief description of the company within the job post.

department.description: The department or team name within the company for the job position.

job_title.description: The entire job title, including team name or specialization if present in the title.

job_description.description: Comprehensive job description including all its sentences.

date_posted.description: Date posted, only if present on the page.

apply_url.description: The URL where applicants can apply for the job.

job_benefits.description: A list of benefits provided with the job.

qualifications.description: A list of required qualifications or certifications for the job.

preferred_qualifications.description: A list of preferred (but not mandatory) qualifications for the job.

role.description: Details about the role including responsibilities and required skills.

skills.description: A list of knowledge, skills or abilities required for the job.

recruiter_email.description: Email address of the recruiter or hiring manager for contact.

application_deadline.description: The deadline for submitting job applications.

employment_type.description: The type of employment (e.g., full-time, part-time, contract).

title.description: Title or name of the contract

description.description: Description or synopsis field. Combine the solicitation summary and additional instructions section / process.

location.description: Location of the issuer. May be a combination of city and state

type.description: Type of contract. May be placed under `Solicitation Type`, `Opportunity Type`, `Market Type`, etc. Not a 'status' field

category.description: Category the contract falls under if given

posted_date.description: Date the contract was made available for bidding. NOT the 'effective', 'start', or 'award' date.

due_date.description: Date the contract closes for bidding. NOT the end term date.

buyer_name.description: Name of the company, organization, or agency that issued the contract. NOT a person's name.

buyer_contact_name.description: Name of the specific individual that is leading the contract, if available

attachments.description: A list of all of the files/documents attached to the contract (e.g. hyperlinks to PDF's)

due_date.description: The due date of the document. This should be a required field. On some websites, it may be listed as "opening date". This date should always be greater than posted_date.

attachments.description: An array of attachments associated with the document.

posted_date.description: The date the document was posted. This date should always be less than due_date

contact_name.description: The name of the buyer related to the document.

contact_email.description: The email address of the buyer.

contact_number.description: The contact number of the buyer.

industry_items.description: An array of procurement industry items related to the opportunity

code.description: The code associated with the procurement item.

code_type.description: The type of code for the procurement item. This could be NIGP, UNSPC, etc

description.description: A description of the procurement item itself

code_description.description: The detailed description of the code itself and the category it represents.

issuing_entity.description: The organization that issued the solicitation.

solicitation_id.description: The provided solicitation ID of the document.

pre_proposal_time.description: The pre-proposal time of the document.

solicitation_type.description: The type of the document. RFP/RFC/etc

solicitation_stage.description: The current stage of the solicitation

pre_proposal_description.description: The pre-proposal location of the document.

id.description: The unique identifier for the document

due_date.description: The due date of the document

posted_date.description: The date the document was posted

buyer_contact_name.description: The name of the buyer contact

buyer_contact_email.description: The email of the buyer contact

buyer_contact_number.description: The phone number of the buyer contact

alias_mpns.description: Other MPNs that this part is known by

author.description: Author of the main or original post

content.description: Entire content of the original post, including all sentences

up_votes.description: Number of likes, upvotes, etc on the original post

num_comments.description: Number of comments or responses, not including the original post

website.description: URL of the attorney's profile page

title.description: Title of the attorney, such as Associate, Counsel, or Partner

practice_areas_main.description: Primary practice areas of the attorney

phone.description: Direct phone number of the attorney

bio.description: Main bio description of the attorney

title.description: Title at the previous law firm

dates.description: Duration of employment at the law firm

experience.description: Past work history at other law firms

matters.description: List of past cases and work done by the attorney

law_school.description: Law school information of the attorney

other_schools.description: Other education details of the attorney

date.description: Date or duration when the award was received

url.description: URL link to the award recognition

awards.description: Awards and recognitions received by the attorney

pdf_url.description: Link to a PDF bio of the attorney

photo_url.description: Link to the photo of the attorney

news.description: Links to news articles involving the attorney

website.description: URL of the job listing. May or may not be unique to this job.

tier.description: Categorize into: Associate (general), Junior Associate, Mid-Level Associate, Senior Associate, Partner, Other (catch all if unsure).

title.description: Job title. Remove location but keep everything else.

locations.description: Offices/cities/locations where this job is being offered.

salary_range.description: Pay range specifically stated in the listing.

experience.description: Required experience specifically stated in the listing.

full.description: Complete information related to this job including HTML content for links.

name.description: The name of the document. Can be a the text of a name/title element on the page, the combination of text of two elements, link text, or title attribute. Use the option that best captures the name for all output data. Ensure your selection doesn't lead to null or incorrect names for output rows. Do not use generic link text as the name such as a download or read more buttons.

url.description: The URL to the document. This could be a pdf, xls, webpage, etc. If and only if there are multiple link choices for a single document, prefer the PDF link

email.description: The email address of the individual

phone_number.description: Phone number of the individual within the school. Do not include irrelevant text.

title.description: The title or role of the individual within the school

product_id.description: A unique identifier for each product.

categories.description: The categories the product falls under. E.g. Shoes, Jeans, Activewear.

product_description.description: A detailed description of the product, usually under the details section.

discounted_price.description: The discounted price of the product, if available.

size.description: The sizes available for the product, if applicable.

color.description: The colors available for the product.

images.description: A list of URLs pointing to images of the product.

availability.description: The availability status of the product (e.g., out of stock, pre-order). Leave blank if no specific status is shown.

shipping_details.description: Information related to shipping, including delivery estimates, cost, etc.

return_policy.description: Description of the return policy for the product.

tags.description: Keywords or phrases related to the product for categorization and searchability.
